com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body

Class ID3v24FrameBodySignature

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.util.Utility
      • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body.ID3v24FrameBodyUtility
        • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body.ID3v24FrameBody
          • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body.ID3v24FrameBodySignature

  • public class ID3v24FrameBodySignature
extends ID3v24FrameBody

    A signature frame body enables a group of frames, grouped with GRID frames, to be signed. Although signatures can reside inside the group id registration frame, it might be desirable to store the signature elsewhere, e.g. in watermarks.

    Seek Frame Body Fields
     FieldDescription
    1. id a number from 0 - 255 which uniquely identifies the group.
    2. signaturebinary signature of the group.



    There may be more than one signature frame in in an ID3v2.4 tag, but no two may have the same group id.

    See Also:
    ID3v24Frame, ID3 tag version 2.4.0 standard, wikipedia history of ID3 tags

    • Constructor Detail

      • ID3v24FrameBodySignature

        public ID3v24FrameBodySignature()
        The constructor is called when creating a new frame. The default values used are:
        • group id of 0
        • empty signature


      • ID3v24FrameBodySignature

        public ID3v24FrameBodySignature(byte id,
                        byte[] signature)
        This constructor is called when creating a new frame.

        Parameters:
        id - a number from 0 - 255 which uniquely identifies the group.
        signature - the binary signature of the group.

      • ID3v24FrameBodySignature

        public ID3v24FrameBodySignature(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                        int frameBodySize)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This constructor is called when reading in an existing frame from an .mp3 file. This is then followed by a call to the parse() method.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - input stream pointing to a signature frame body in the .mp3 file.
        frameBodySize - size (in bytes) of the frame's body.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading the frame body.

      • setBuffer

        public void setBuffer()
        If the frame body's values have been modified, then resize the raw binary buffer and store the new values there. When finished, the dirty flag is reset to indicate that the buffer is up to date, and the frame is now ready to be saved to the .mp3 file.
        Overrides:
        setBuffer in class ID3v24FrameBody
